trans-unit.source: Creating a Custom Service Bus Binding
trans-unit.target: Creating a Custom Service Bus Binding

trans-unit.source: This section discusses the transport binding primitives.
trans-unit.target: This section discusses the transport binding primitives.

trans-unit.source: If you want to create a <token>indigo1</token> custom binding, use one of these binding elements to send to or listen on <token>sb2</token>, instead of using the corresponding <token>indigo2</token> transport binding elements.
trans-unit.target: If you want to create a <token>indigo1</token> custom binding, use one of these binding elements to send to or listen on <token>sb2</token>, instead of using the corresponding <token>indigo2</token> transport binding elements.

trans-unit.source: TcpRelayTransportBindingElement
trans-unit.target: TcpRelayTransportBindingElement

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> element is closely aligned with the <token>indigo2</token> version, <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TcpTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> and is the foundation for <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> element is closely aligned with the <token>indigo2</token> version, <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TcpTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> and is the foundation for <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: Additional members
trans-unit.target: Additional members

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> class uses a federated security token authorization scheme to guard access to <token>sb2</token> and to the services listening through it.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference qualifyHint="true">T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.TcpRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> class uses a federated security token authorization scheme to guard access to <token>sb2</token> and to the services listening through it.

trans-unit.source: This property controls whether clients of a service are required to present a security token issued by the <token>ac2</token> service to the <token>sb2</token> service when it sends messages.
trans-unit.target: This property controls whether clients of a service are required to present a security token issued by the <token>ac2</token> service to the <token>sb2</token> service when it sends messages.

trans-unit.source: Services are always required to authenticate with <token>ac2</token> and present an authorization token to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Services are always required to authenticate with <token>ac2</token> and present an authorization token to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: If the service assumes the responsibility of authenticating/authorizing clients, it can opt out of the integration between <token>ac2</token> and <token>sb2</token> by setting this property to <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.None</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: If the service assumes the responsibility of authenticating/authorizing clients, it can opt out of the integration between <token>ac2</token> and <token>sb2</token> by setting this property to <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.None</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: See the discussion of Connection Modes in <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: See the discussion of Connection Modes in <languageKeyword>NetTcpRelayBinding</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: The following are the <languageKeyword>Connection Mode</languageKeyword> values:
trans-unit.target: The following are the <languageKeyword>Connection Mode</languageKeyword> values:

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>TcpConnectionMode.Relayed</languageKeyword>: In this mode, all communication is relayed through the <token>sb2</token> cloud.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>TcpConnectionMode.Relayed</languageKeyword>: In this mode, all communication is relayed through the <token>sb2</token> cloud.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>TcpConnectionMode.Hybrid</languageKeyword>: In this mode, communication is relayed through <token>sb2</token>, whereas the client and service endpoints negotiate a direct socket connection to each other.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>TcpConnectionMode.Hybrid</languageKeyword>: In this mode, communication is relayed through <token>sb2</token>, whereas the client and service endpoints negotiate a direct socket connection to each other.

trans-unit.source: If a direct connection can be established, the relayed connection is automatically upgraded to the direct connection.
trans-unit.target: If a direct connection can be established, the relayed connection is automatically upgraded to the direct connection.

trans-unit.source: <languageKeyword>TcpConnectionMode.Direct</languageKeyword>: This mode is identical to <languageKeyword>TcpConnectionMode.Hybrid</languageKeyword>.
trans-unit.target: <languageKeyword>TcpConnectionMode.Direct</languageKeyword>: This mode is identical to <languageKeyword>TcpConnectionMode.Hybrid</languageKeyword>.

trans-unit.source: This property gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether transport protection (SSL) is enabled for the connection.
trans-unit.target: This property gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether transport protection (SSL) is enabled for the connection.

trans-unit.source: With this property set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, outbound communication uses SSL through port 828.
trans-unit.target: With this property set to <languageKeyword>true</languageKeyword>, outbound communication uses SSL through port 828.

trans-unit.source: With the property set to <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, outbound communication uses port 808.
trans-unit.target: With the property set to <languageKeyword>false</languageKeyword>, outbound communication uses port 808.

trans-unit.source: HttpRelayTransportBindingElement
trans-unit.target: HttpRelayTransportBindingElement

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.HttpRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> element is closely aligned with the <token>indigo2</token> version, <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> and is the foundation for all HTTP relay bindings that are configured to use unsecured HTTP communication.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.HttpRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> element is closely aligned with the <token>indigo2</token> version, <codeEntityReference>T:System.ServiceModel.Channels.HttpTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> and is the foundation for all HTTP relay bindings that are configured to use unsecured HTTP communication.

trans-unit.source: Additional members
trans-unit.target: Additional members

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: The <languageKeyword>HttpRelayTransportBindingElement</languageKeyword> uses a federated security token authorization scheme to guard access to <token>sb2</token> and to the services listening through it.
trans-unit.target: The <languageKeyword>HttpRelayTransportBindingElement</languageKeyword> uses a federated security token authorization scheme to guard access to <token>sb2</token> and to the services listening through it.

trans-unit.source: This property controls whether clients of a service are required to present a security token issued by the <token>ac2</token> service to <token>sb2</token> service when it sends messages.
trans-unit.target: This property controls whether clients of a service are required to present a security token issued by the <token>ac2</token> service to <token>sb2</token> service when it sends messages.

trans-unit.source: Services (listeners) are always required to authenticate with <token>ac2</token> and present an authorization token to <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: Services (listeners) are always required to authenticate with <token>ac2</token> and present an authorization token to <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: If the service assumes the responsibility of authenticating and authorizing clients, it can opt out of the integration between <token>ac2</token> and <token>sb2</token> by setting this property to <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.None</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: If the service assumes the responsibility of authenticating and authorizing clients, it can opt out of the integration between <token>ac2</token> and <token>sb2</token> by setting this property to <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.None</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: The default value is <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference>.
trans-unit.target: The default value is <codeEntityReference>F:Microsoft.ServiceBus.RelayClientAuthenticationType.RelayAccessToken</codeEntityReference>.

trans-unit.source: HttpsRelayTransportBindingElement
trans-unit.target: HttpsRelayTransportBindingElement

trans-unit.source: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.HttpsRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> element derives from <languageKeyword>HttpRelayTransportBindingElement</languageKeyword> and is the foundation for all HTTP relay bindings that are configured to use secured HTTPS communication.
trans-unit.target: The <codeEntityReference>T:Microsoft.ServiceBus.HttpsRelayTransportBindingElement</codeEntityReference> element derives from <languageKeyword>HttpRelayTransportBindingElement</languageKeyword> and is the foundation for all HTTP relay bindings that are configured to use secured HTTPS communication.
